name: Loblaw Pharmacy
address: Loblaw Pharmacy, 350 SE Marine Dr, Vancouver, BC V5X 2S5

featured_reviews.review_id: Pharmacy manager goes beyond to provide exceptional service. Phone in automated refill service is great. Some of the pharmacy technicians could use some customer service retraining or learn to experience some empathy. Try not to go during peak business hours, lines ups will be long. The wait for prescriptions will be approximately 45 mins - 1 hour. Do your grocery shopping while you wait.

featured_reviews.review_id: Save yourself some stress by going to a different pharmacy! I should have checked the google reviews before wasting my time. ALL the pharmacy staff in this location is a joke. No regard for privacy, they look like they don't know what they're doing, doesn't communicate properly and looks like they don't want to be there to do a proper job! What a shame, such unprofessional team.

featured_reviews.review_id: Dropped off my prescription at 5pm today and was told that it will be ready in 1 hour, so I leave and come back at 6:30pm because I know their estimate is never right. I go up to the counter to pick up my medication and they tell me to wait on the side for 5 minutes and pointed towards the "medication information" corner. I wait in the medication information corner for about 40 minutes while they process 10 other people who received and paid for medications. The person who initially told me to wait for 5 minutes left to go for her break and did not tell anyone about my prescription. I went to line up again for the prescription pickup line and they just took it from the counter and gave it to me. I don't understand why the person who went for their break did not just process my prescription when it was already ready and on the counter.

featured_reviews.review_id: Very very disappointed with staff. I went to pharmacy today around 11:30am and there was long line ups and i understand they were busy. However, the female pharmacist she looks very tired with no smile at all and she looks like she doesn't care at all. Also, there was another asian female staff at pick up prescription area and she was super rude. I didnt understand what she told me was and i asked same question twice and suddenly both of staff(female pharmacist and pick up area staff) they were laughing in front of me which is ridiculous and very rude. This pharmacy needs to re-train your staff there, all the staff there was super rude and they need to learn how to greet customer and also need to learn how to smile at customer. I will never visit this pharmacy never again!! very unprofessional

featured_reviews.review_id:
Stay away! Such Unprofessionals are working there.
1, super long wait time.
2, poor communication
3, Big mistake, I found someone's durg in my receipt bag.
Please find a better pharmacy and stay safe.

featured_reviews.review_id: April update: the staff are great. I see them hustle every time I get medication filled. They are understaffed and overworked but do their best to help. Any issues I've had in the past are out of their control.
featured_reviews.review_text: April update: the staff are great. I see them hustle every time I get medication filled. They are understaffed and overworked but do their best to help. Any issues I've had in the past are out of their control.

featured_reviews.review_id: It's my first time to go this pharmacy and it was terrible.  When I drop my prescription, Darison helped me but she was very rude and disrespect the customer. She think queen of the pharmacy or something. And she told me will be ready after 35min then when I pick up my staff they are not ready. I was waiting extra 1 hour..... Can you please hire good manger here?

featured_reviews.review_id: I don't want to be rude and I don't usually like to leave negative reviews but this place is very... Challenging, I'll say. I haven't had much of a problem at the counter or with wait times, but the first few times I filled a prescription they kept forgetting or failing to bill my extended benefits. Annoying but not awful. My biggest challenge is refills. The phone number currently printed on the bottles is incorrect. The phone number listed on Google is also wrong. Even the automated system you get when you call Superstore sends you to the wrong number. I had to get someone at the customer service desk to tell me the number, hang up, and redial it directly. I picked this pharmacy because I recently moved nearby and I usually get my groceries at Superstore, so this seemed like an easy decision. How could it be less convenient than driving 25 minutes across town to my old pharmacy near my old apartment? Superstore accepted my challenge and exceeded my expectations.
